Key.Original: Welcome to Warriors Haven Framework!%1If you're new to this gamemode, you should check out the Getting Started guide on your map journal.
Enemies are planning to to steal medical and food supplies from a distribution center. You must assist local security in defending the supplies and maintaining civil order.

%1 out of %2 civilians are alive. While not required, we should protect most of them during this defense. This objective will be canceled if there are %4 casualties or more.
Hint: Use the Detain keybind to escort them to safety!
%1 out of %2 supply crates are being distributed. At least %3 crates must remain until %4, otherwise this mission will fail.
Enemies have set up AA batteries at this location. Destroy them!
There is an AA battery in this area.

Enemies are staging armor and support vehicles for their next operation. We know of %1 vehicles that are present in <marker name="%2">this area</marker>. You must conduct a preemptive strike and destroy all vehicles at this location.
Enemies have established field artillery sites at this location. You must destroy all cannons in the area.
Enemies have deployed a field barracks to house additional personnel for reinforcements. Eradicate them with extreme prejudice.
Enemies have set up a roadblock at this location. Destroy them!
A military research building has been found containing intel. Secure it!
A list of targets that have been reported by JTACs.
This vehicle has been reported by %2. Destroy it!

Enemy forces have established their presence at <marker name="%1">%2</marker> to host their operations. We are to complete all sub-objectives and eliminate a majority of their units to force a retreat. Expect garrisons, turrets, minefields, and patrols sweeping the region.
We've identified the approximate location of their Command & Control facility. Capture or eliminate the OPFOR commander.
We've identified the approximate location of their communications hub. You must disable the radio transmitter, seize their servers, and extract intelligence from their officer.
We've identified the approximate location of their service depot. Destroy it!
A majority of their forces still remain in this area. We need to neutralize at least %1 more units before this mission is complete, including any reinforcements that have arrived.
%1 are exchanging weapons and munitions with %2 at this location. We need to disrupt this transfer and secure their caches.
There is not enough space to deploy your quadbike.
Are you sure you want to respawn this %1?
Hold this key to reveal any contextual actions from the mission. Disabled when ACE is loaded.
Toggle cruise control when driving.\nDisabled when ACE is loaded.
Increase set speed while cruise control is enabled.\nDisabled when ACE is loaded.
Decrease set speed while cruise control is enabled.\nDisabled when ACE is loaded.

This is a persistent, Invade & Annex-like mission where players are working together to complete procedurally generated objectives across the map of %1.

This mission was developed by thegamecracks and Vicious Resilience as part of the Warriors Haven community. This took a lot of hard work to make, so thank you for playing!

Playing solo and want a taste of combat? Grab yourself your favorite gun and a lot of first aid kits, then recruit some AI and halo jump into the main objective!

The following keybinds are provided by this mission:
- Detain: [T]
- Earplugs: [End]

The following keybinds are also available when ACE is not loaded:
- Context Menu: [Left Windows]
- Repack Magazines: [Ctrl+R]
- Holster Weapon: [4]
- Cruise Control: [Insert]
- Cruise Up: [Ctrl+Mouse wheel up]
- Cruise Down: [Ctrl+Mouse wheel down]

If you have CBA loaded, these keybinds can be changed by going to your Controls > Configure Addons menu.

When available, halo jumping may be accessed from anywhere by holding the Context Menu keybind. This allows you to drop over any location of your choosing, as long as it is not within coverage of enemy anti-air vehicles. Halo jumps can carry along AI recruits and vehicles.

If you have CBA installed, you can customize how high you want to be dropped off, when recruit/vehicle parachutes automatically deploy, and the separation between your units.

Depending on server settings, halo jumping may become hidden after a certain number of players have joined.

NOTE: this section does not apply if ACE Medical is loaded.

Once you have been significantly wounded, you will become incapacitated and unable to move. There are four ways to recover from incapacitation:
1. Press Escape and respawn back at base;
2. Pray for an act of god;
3. Wait for a player medic to revive you, or;
4. Perform a self-revive.

Depending on server settings, options (3) and (4) may have different requirements to succeed. By default, players can only revive units when they are a Medic, have a Medkit on hand, and have one First Aid Kit to be consumed. The last two item requirements will check the incapacitated unit's inventory first, so medics that have forgotten their medkit or have ran out of first aid kits can still perform revives on anyone that has the necessary items themselves.

For self-reviving, this option typically appears after three seconds, and allows any player with at least three First Aid Kits to self-revive themselves. Depending on server settings, self-reviving may become hidden after a certain number of players have joined.

Certain objects around the base, typically flag poles, may serve as places for group leaders to request AI recruits. Recruits can be spawned for a subset of player roles, including AT Specialists, Engineers, and Medics.

Each time you select a role for your next recruit, they will receive the last loadout you used in that role. If you have yet to play as that role, or have not yet made a loadout for it, they will receive a default loadout. In this case, you can edit their loadout by looking at them and using the Edit Recruit Loadout action. The loadout you give them will be saved to the role, allowing you to reuse the loadout for future recruits.

Depending on server settings, recruit actions may become hidden after a certain number of players have joined.

Repair depots provide service capabilities to all players within range. You must park your vehicle near the depot, exit it, and look at the vehicle to service it. This will repair, refuel, and rearm your vehicle, including its Active Protection System if it has one.

Depending on server settings, certain vehicles will be locked to a specific role or owner. These locks typically apply to the driver seat only, but may also apply to gunner and passenger seats. Aircraft provided by Vehicle Spawners will have their pilot seats locked to the owner.

Certain objects around the base, typically laptops, may serve as vehicle spawners and can provide various types of vehicles. Some vehicle types, like Artillery, Tanks, and Helicopters, are only available for certain roles like Artillery Gunner, Engineer, and Transport Pilot respectively.

Once you spawn a vehicle, all Vehicle Spawners will enter a cooldown based on the specific vehicle you have chosen.

Depending on server settings, players and AI with backpack drones may be able to assemble them as FPV drones. After placing these drones on the ground, they will autonomously target enemies and attempt to explode within proximity of them. Shooting the drone or killing the pilot will also cause the drone to detonate.

You can assemble your own FPV drones by wearing a backpack drone and selecting Assemble FPV Drone. If this option does not show up, either the server has FPV drones disabled, or FPV drones can only be assembled by Drone Operators. Beware, these drones cannot be disassembled or remote controlled, and can explode themselves even when there are friendlies nearby!
Press this key to enable and disable earplugs.
No supported factions in faction pool for %1. Using %2 faction as fallback.
Select a point on the map to halo jump to.

Steam Workshop | GitHub
Welcome to Warriors Haven Framework!
Players must work together to fight opposing forces and complete objectives across the map of %1.
For more details about keybinds and game mechanics, open your in-game map and click "Getting Started" on the top left.
This took a lot of hard work to make, so thank you for playing!
%1 (JTAC) has identified a target for tasking, %2 at grid %3.
%1 (JTAC) has identified a target near %4 for tasking, %2 at grid %3.
Press this key to holster your current weapon.
This seat can only be used by a %1.
This seat can only be used by %1.
You cannot take control of this vehicle!
You've arrived! The raiders are about to attack soon. Take your positions!
Hey, they're hitting us now! Bearing %1!
A supply crate is being stolen!
Enemies have taken majority of the supplies!
We're halfway there. Keep holding them off!
Just one minute left, we're almost done!
The humanitarian supplies have been successfully defended. Good work!
We've destroyed the anti-air artillery site. Good work!
We've destroyed all vehicles at the armor depot. Good work!
We've destroyed the artillery site. Good work!
We've eliminated the stationed reinforcements at the barracks. Good work!
We've eliminated the stationed enemies at the roadblock. Good work!
Someone needs to stay near the intel laptop!
Intel has been downloaded! Time for you to move out!
Enemy forces have established their presence at %1. Time to roll out!
We have taken control of %1. Return to base and prepare for your next objective.
The OPFOR commander was captured by %1!
The OPFOR commander was eliminated by %1!
We've intercepted all ammunition caches. Good work!
Press this key while looking at an enemy to command them to surrender.
You're not going to stop me!
Okay, okay! I surrender! Don't shoot!
I dropped my gun, don't shoot!
I surrender! Don't kill me, please!
I give up! Don't kill me, please!
My gun's on the ground! Don't shoot me!
You must be a group leader to manage your recruits.
You have reached the recruit limit of %1.
The global limit of %1 recruits has been reached.
The player limit of %1 players has been reached.
No recruits in range to rearm.
Press this key while on foot or in a vehicle to repack your magazines.\nIgnored if magazines are already repacked.
Must be a medic to revive!
You need %1 first aid kits to self-revive! (%2 missing)
Revived by an act of god!
Toggles APS usage and simulation. Can be disabled to improve performance.
The distance in metres from which threats are considered for intercept.\nHigher distances can improve reliability against faster projectiles, but may worsen performance.
How frequently threats are scanned around APS-enabled vehicles every second.\nHigher scan rates can improve reliability against faster projectiles, but may worsen performance.
The distance factor at which threats are intercepted.\nActual intercept distance is determined by the projectile's speed and the scan rate.
The number of APS charges loaded on MRAPs.
The number of APS charges loaded on APCs and IFVs.
The number of APS charges loaded on MBTs.
A list of steamID64 strings to automatically assign curator modules to.
The percentage of damage that players receive.\nHas no effect when ACE Medical is loaded.
The percentage of damage that AI recruits receive.\nHas no effect when ACE Medical is loaded.
Toggles hit sounds when shooting entities.
Toggles the ability for players and AI to assemble combat drones.
If enabled, players must be a Drone Operator to assemble combat drones.
If enabled, other players will be prevented from connecting to drones you assemble.
Toggles the vanilla Dynamic Simulation system.
The distance in metres that units and vehicles are simulated up to.
The percentage volume reduction. Setting to 100% will mute most sounds.
Toggles effect of earplugs on radio callouts from players and AI.
Toggles effect of earplugs on ingame music.
Sets the amount of weapon sway for all players.
Toggles the use of signal flares by AI to communicate threats to nearby allies.
Toggles the use of signal flares from AI leaders in BLUFOR groups.
How often to check for eligible units.
The cooldown between signal flares shared amongst all local enemies.
The cooldown between signal flares for a single group.
The max distance that squad leaders can deploy signal flares for.
The max distance at which nearby allies receive intel from signal flares.
The max distance from any player before mission objects can be deleted.
The max distance from any player before hidden objects (usually terrain) can be revealed.
The altitude in metres to halo jump units from, when there are no vehicles included.
The altitude in metres to halo jump units from, when vehicles are included.
The altitude in metres when units automatically deploy parachutes.\nOnly applies to players if vehicles are included in the halo jump.
The altitude in metres when vehicles automatically deploy parachutes.
The distance in metres between units when halo jumping.
The distance in metres between vehicles when halo jumping.
The max distance in metres that enemy AA vehicles can prevent halo jumping.
The max distance in metres that enemy units can prevent halo jumping.
If enabled, players can halo jump out of active mission areas.
The maximum number of players allowed before the Halo Jump action is hidden.
Toggles ejecting units, including the player, from vehicles not included in the halo jump.
Toggles 3D icons over players and recruits.
If enabled, 3D icons will only show over your group members.
The max distance in metres at which you will see 3D icons.
Toggles map icons for players and AI.
Allows projectile icons to be shown over friendly projectiles.
Allows projectile icons to be shown over your own projectiles.
Toggles temporary 3D icons revealing the source of missile launches when in a vehicle.
The maximum number of JTAC tasks that can be active. When this is exceeded, the oldest JTAC task is automatically cleared.\nIf disabled, JTACs will not be able to report targets.

This can be used to switch between loadout collections without overwriting your previous loadouts.\nBefore changing this ID, make sure you write it down so you can restore your loadouts!\nIf set to "" or "default", default mission loadouts are always used.
Toggles the role/owner-based vehicle lock system. In singleplayer, this is always disabled.
Toggles extension of locks to taking control for aircraft copilots. Only applies to role-based locks.
The cooldown in seconds after attempting to detain a unit.
If enabled, rounds from full magazines can be repacked into higher capacity magazines.\nThis prevents discarding high capacity magazines even when you have ammo in smaller magazines.

The maximum number of players allowed before the Self-Revive action is hidden.\nIf set to 0, self-reviving will be disabled.\nThis also affects recruits, as they will die immediately unless Always Incapacitate? is enabled.
The time to wait before a unit can self-revive.
The duration in seconds needed to hold the self-revive action.
The number of first aid kits required to self-revive.
The duration in seconds after being revived where enemies will not target the player.
The duration that the player can remain incapacitated before bleeding out.
The number of first aid kits required to revive another unit.
Toggles the medic trait requirement to revive other units.
Toggles the medkit item requirement to revive other units.
Toggles the use of modded first aid kits for reviving.\nIf disabled, only vanilla First Aid Kits are used.
Toggles the use of modded medkits for reviving.\nIf disabled, only the vanilla Medkit can be used.
Prevent friendly fire between players when near a respawn. Disabled when ACE is loaded.
The safezone radius around all respawn markers.
Allow players to service any vehicle near a repair depot.
Toggles actions to let players skip time. These actions are always available for admins.
The duration in seconds needed to unflip vehicles.
The maximum vehicle angle allowed to be unflipped.\n100% is straight up (always allowed), 0% is at least perpendicular to terrain, and -100% is exactly straight down.
The distance in metres to search around the vehicle for an empty position.\nHigh values may worsen performance.
The skill level of AI units, not including player recruits.
The equipment that AI units spawn with.
The location types allowed for spawning the Annex mission.
Only allow the Annex mission to spawn in locations that have a name.
The scale factor applied to the Annex mission's size. Additionally affects number of units.
The percentage of units that need to be killed to complete the mission.
The scale factor applied to the number of fortifications spawned. Affected by mission size.
An array of unit types, group min/max sizes, skills, and probabilities to spawn.\nThe first unit type is always used for garrisons.
The scale factor applied to the number of vehicles spawned. Affected by mission size.
An array of vehicle types to spawn. Can be any of "standard", "supply", "mrap", "apc", "ifv", "mbt", "aa".
The delay between reinforcement units spawned.
The delay between reinforcement vehicles spawned.
An array of battery types with weights to spawn. Can be any of "aa_short", "aa_medium", or "aa_long".
Toggles the creation of main missions. This does not interrupt in-progress missions.
When there are fewer main missions than this, new missions are spawned up to the maximum.
The number of main missions to spawn up to. Takes priority over minimum missions.
The scale factor applied to the number of units spawned across all main missions.
Toggles playing music at the end of a main mission.
Toggles the creation of side missions. This does not interrupt in-progress missions.
When there are fewer side missions than this, new missions are spawned up to the maximum.
The number of side missions to spawn up to. Takes priority over minimum missions.
The scale factor applied to the number of units spawned across all side missions.
The identity used for you and your recruits.\nChanges take effect after respawning.
Toggles you and/or your AI recruits speaking and responding to commands.\nChanges take effect after respawning. Does not affect recruits from other players.
Prevents your AI recruits from targeting lasers when using vehicle weapons.
The maximum number of recruits that can be commanded per player group.
The maximum number of recruits that can be commanded across all players.
The maximum number of players allowed before the Spawn Recruit action is hidden.
The skill level of AI recruits.
The distance in metres that recruits will search for their group's own incapacitated units to revive.\nRecruits will abandon their group to revive units.
The distance in metres that recruits will search for other incapacitated units to revive.\nRecruits will abandon their group to revive units.
The class of units that recruits will automatically revive if able to do so.\nRegardless of this setting, recruits can always be manually ordered to revive a specific unit via the command menu.
The duration that incapacitated recruits will wait before self-reviving.
The duration that incapacitated recruits will wait for a medic recruit before self-reviving.\nAlso applies when the recruit is being carried by a player.
The number of FAKs needed for a recruit to self-revive. If disabled, recruits will never self-revive.
Always allow recruits to be incapacitated, even if they are unable to self-revive.
%1 has requested a time skip to morning! Accelerating time for %2...
%1 has requested a time skip to noon! Accelerating time for %2...
%1 has requested a time skip to evening! Accelerating time for %2...
Time skip to morning has finished!
Time skip to noon has finished!
Time skip to evening has finished!
Skip time is on cooldown for %1.
A time skip is already in progress!
All vehicle crew need to exit before you can unflip it!
CAUTION: Limited space to unflip. Next attempt will unflip the vehicle in-place.
This vehicle was despawned because a new vehicle was requested by %1.
There are no vehicles available from this spawner for your role.
